title: How to cook perfect rice every time
shortBio: Learn how to make fluffy rice that's not sticky or mushy with these simple tips.
details: Rinse the rice several times to remove excess starch.
Use the right amount of water, usually a 1:2 ratio of rice to water.
Let the rice rest for a few minutes after cooking to allow the moisture to distribute evenly.
Fluff the rice with a fork to separate the grains.
Avoid stirring the rice too much during cooking to prevent it from becoming mushy.
Consider using a rice cooker for consistently perfect rice every time.

title: How to make a roux for gravy and sauces
shortBio: A well-made roux is the foundation of many classic sauces and gravies. Here's how to do it.
details: Melt butter or oil in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat.
Add an equal amount of flour and whisk to combine.
Cook the roux, whisking constantly, until it turns a light golden color.
Use a light-colored roux for thinner sauces and a darker roux for thicker gravies.
Be careful not to burn the roux, as it will impart a bitter taste to the finished sauce or gravy.
